intro: Navarretia haydenii, commonly known as the Sierra starflower, is a flowering plant native to California and northern Baja California. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in open areas with full sun exposure. Navarretia haydenii is a perennial herb that produces small, delicate leaves and is known for its early spring blooming period. It plays an important ecological role in supporting pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native range.
